page.title: 03Medburn,a rural hamlet
page.content: This is a hamlet rather than a village,there being no shop,pub or post-office,and only about 30 houses. In{1922}the original farmland was divided into smallholdings. The initial dwellings on each plot were surplus First World War Army huts. Today only 1 poultry farmer remains in business as a smallholding: most plots now house newly built detached residences for owners who commute to employment or business elsewhere. One owner is starting a livery stable and some rent out land for horses. A limited bus service runs through {Medburn. } A local plan sets firm limits on further residential development in reply to residents' concern that the area should retain its rural identity.
